summary.long: Proverbs is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To know wisdom and instruction,
To discern the sayings of understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To receive instruction in wise behavior,
Righteousness, justice and equity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To give prudence to the naive,
To the youth knowledge and discretion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man will hear and increase in learning,
And a man of understanding will acquire wise counsel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To understand a proverb and a figure,
The words of the wise and their riddles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge;
Fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, my son, your father’s instruction
And do not forsake your mother’s teaching;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, they are a graceful wreath to your head
And ornaments about your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if sinners entice you,
Do not consent.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let us swallow them alive like Sheol,
Even whole, as those who go down to the pit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will find all kinds of precious wealth,
We will fill our houses with spoil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Throw in your lot with us,
We shall all have one purse,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not walk in the way with them.
Keep your feet from their path,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their feet run to evil
And they hasten to shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, it is useless to spread the baited net
In the sight of any bird;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they lie in wait for their own blood;
They ambush their own lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So are the ways of everyone who gains by violence;
It takes away the life of its possessors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom shouts in the street,
She lifts her voice in the square;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the head of the noisy streets she cries out;
At the entrance of the gates in the city she utters her sayings:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long, O naive ones, will you love being simple-minded?
And scoffers delight themselves in scoffing
And fools hate knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Because I called and you refused,
I stretched out my hand and no one paid attention;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you neglected all my counsel
And did not want my reproof;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also laugh at your calamity;
I will mock when your dread comes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When your dread comes like a storm
And your calamity comes like a whirlwind,
When distress and anguish come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then they will call on me, but I will not answer;
They will seek me diligently but they will not find me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they hated knowledge
And did not choose the fear of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They would not accept my counsel,
They spurned all my reproof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“So they shall eat of the fruit of their own way
And be satiated with their own devices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For the waywardness of the naive will kill them,
And the complacency of fools will destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But he who listens to me shall live securely
And will be at ease from the dread of evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you will receive my words
And treasure my commandments within you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make your ear attentive to wisdom,
Incline your heart to understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For if you cry for discernment,
Lift your voice for understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you seek her as silver
And search for her as for hidden treasures;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will discern the fear of the Lord
And discover the knowledge of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord gives wisdom;
From His mouth come knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stores up sound wisdom for the upright;
He is a shield to those who walk in integrity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Guarding the paths of justice,
And He preserves the way of His godly ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will discern righteousness and justice
And equity and every good course.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For wisdom will enter your heart
And knowledge will be pleasant to your soul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Discretion will guard you,
Understanding will watch over you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To deliver you from the way of evil,
From the man who speaks perverse things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From those who leave the paths of uprightness
To walk in the ways of darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who delight in doing evil
And rejoice in the perversity of evil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whose paths are crooked,
And who are devious in their ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To deliver you from the strange woman,
From the adulteress who flatters with her words;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That leaves the companion of her youth
And forgets the covenant of her God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For her house sinks down to death
And her tracks lead to the dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
None who go to her return again,
Nor do they reach the paths of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So you will walk in the way of good men
And keep to the paths of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the upright will live in the land
And the blameless will remain in it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the wicked will be cut off from the land
And the treacherous will be uprooted from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not forget my teaching,
But let your heart keep my commandments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For length of days and years of life
And peace they will add to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So you will find favor and good repute
In the sight of God and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord with all your heart
And do not lean on your own understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all your ways acknowledge Him,
And He will make your paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be wise in your own eyes;
Fear the Lord and turn away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be healing to your body
And refreshment to your bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor the Lord from your wealth
And from the first of all your produce;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So your barns will be filled with plenty
And your vats will overflow with new wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not reject the discipline of the Lord
Or loathe His reproof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For whom the Lord loves He reproves,
Even as a father corrects the son in whom he delights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed is the man who finds wisdom
And the man who gains understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For her profit is better than the profit of silver
And her gain better than fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is more precious than jewels;
And nothing you desire compares with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long life is in her right hand;
In her left hand are riches and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her ways are pleasant ways
And all her paths are peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her,
And happy are all who hold her fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord by wisdom founded the earth,
By understanding He established the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By His knowledge the deeps were broken up
And the skies drip with dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, let them not vanish from your sight;
Keep sound wisdom and discretion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they will be life to your soul
And adornment to your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will walk in your way securely
And your foot will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you lie down, you will not be afraid;
When you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be afraid of sudden fear
Nor of the onslaught of the wicked when it comes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will be your confidence
And will keep your foot from being caught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due,
When it is in your power to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come back,
And tomorrow I will give it,”
When you have it with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not devise harm against your neighbor,
While he lives securely beside you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not contend with a man without cause,
If he has done you no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not envy a man of violence
And do not choose any of his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the devious are an abomination to the Lord;
But He is intimate with the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The curse of the Lord is on the house of the wicked,
But He blesses the dwelling of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though He scoffs at the scoffers,
Yet He gives grace to the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise will inherit honor,
But fools display dishonor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O sons, the instruction of a father,
And give attention that you may gain understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I give you sound teaching;
Do not abandon my instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I was a son to my father,
Tender and the only son in the sight of my mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Acquire wisdom! Acquire understanding!
Do not forget nor turn away from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not forsake her, and she will guard you;
Love her, and she will watch over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The beginning of wisdom is: Acquire wisdom;
And with all your acquiring, get understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Prize her, and she will exalt you;
She will honor you if you embrace her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“She will place on your head a garland of grace;
She will present you with a crown of beauty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, my son, and accept my sayings
And the years of your life will be many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have directed you in the way of wisdom;
I have led you in upright paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you walk, your steps will not be impeded;
And if you run, you will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take hold of instruction; do not let go.
Guard her, for she is your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not enter the path of the wicked
And do not proceed in the way of evil men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Avoid it, do not pass by it;
Turn away from it and pass on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they cannot sleep unless they do evil;
And they are robbed of sleep unless they make someone stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they eat the bread of wickedness
And drink the wine of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn,
That shines brighter and brighter until the full day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the wicked is like darkness;
They do not know over what they stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, give attention to my words;
Incline your ear to my sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let them depart from your sight;
Keep them in the midst of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they are life to those who find them
And health to all their body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Watch over your heart with all diligence,
For from it flow the springs of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put away from you a deceitful mouth
And put devious speech far from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your eyes look directly ahead
And let your gaze be fixed straight in front of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Watch the path of your feet
And all your ways will be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not turn to the right nor to the left;
Turn your foot from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, give attention to my wisdom,
Incline your ear to my understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That you may observe discretion
And your lips may reserve knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the lips of an adulteress drip honey
And smoother than oil is her speech;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But in the end she is bitter as wormwood,
Sharp as a two-edged sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her feet go down to death,
Her steps take hold of Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She does not ponder the path of life;
Her ways are unstable, she does not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now then, my sons, listen to me
And do not depart from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your way far from her
And do not go near the door of her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or you will give your vigor to others
And your years to the cruel one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And strangers will be filled with your strength
And your hard-earned goods will go to the house of an alien;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you groan at your final end,
When your flesh and your body are consumed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you say, “How I have hated instruction!
And my heart spurned reproof!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have not listened to the voice of my teachers,
Nor inclined my ear to my instructors!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I was almost in utter ruin
In the midst of the assembly and congregation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drink water from your own cistern
And fresh water from your own well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should your springs be dispersed abroad,
Streams of water in the streets?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be yours alone
And not for strangers with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your fountain be blessed,
And rejoice in the wife of your youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For why should you, my son, be exhilarated with an adulteress
And embrace the bosom of a foreigner?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the ways of a man are before the eyes of the Lord,
And He watches all his paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His own iniquities will capture the wicked,
And he will be held with the cords of his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will die for lack of instruction,
And in the greatness of his folly he will go astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you have become surety for your neighbor,
Have given a pledge for a stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have been snared with the words of your mouth,
Have been caught with the words of your mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give no sleep to your eyes,
Nor slumber to your eyelids;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver yourself like a gazelle from the hunter’s hand
And like a bird from the hand of the fowler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go to the ant, O sluggard,
Observe her ways and be wise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which, having no chief,
Officer or ruler,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prepares her food in the summer
And gathers her provision in the harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you lie down, O sluggard?
When will you arise from your sleep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A little sleep, a little slumber,
A little folding of the hands to rest”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your poverty will come in like a vagabond
And your need like an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worthless person, a wicked man,
Is the one who walks with a perverse mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who winks with his eyes, who signals with his feet,
Who points with his fingers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who with perversity in his heart continually devises evil,
Who spreads strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore his calamity will come suddenly;
Instantly he will be broken and there will be no healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are six things which the Lord hates,
Yes, seven which are an abomination to Him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Haughty eyes, a lying tongue,
And hands that shed innocent blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A heart that devises wicked plans,
Feet that run rapidly to evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness who utters lies,
And one who spreads strife among brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, observe the commandment of your father
And do not forsake the teaching of your mother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bind them continually on your heart;
Tie them around your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching is light;
And reproofs for discipline are the way of life
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To keep you from the evil woman,
From the smooth tongue of the adulteress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not desire her beauty in your heart,
Nor let her capture you with her eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For on account of a harlot one is reduced to a loaf of bread,
And an adulteress hunts for the precious life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man take fire in his bosom
And his clothes not be burned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or can a man walk on hot coals
And his feet not be scorched?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So is the one who goes in to his neighbor’s wife;
Whoever touches her will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Men do not despise a thief if he steals
To satisfy himself when he is hungry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But when he is found, he must repay sevenfold;
He must give all the substance of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who commits adultery with a woman is lacking sense;
He who would destroy himself does it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wounds and disgrace he will find,
And his reproach will not be blotted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For jealousy enrages a man,
And he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not accept any ransom,
Nor will he be satisfied though you give many gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep my words
And treasure my commandments within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep my commandments and live,
And my teaching as the apple of your eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bind them on your fingers;
Write them on the tablet of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”
And call understanding your intimate friend;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That they may keep you from an adulteress,
From the foreigner who flatters with her words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For at the window of my house
I looked out through my lattice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I saw among the naive,
And discerned among the youths
A young man lacking sense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Passing through the street near her corner;
And he takes the way to her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the twilight, in the evening,
In the middle of the night and in the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And behold, a woman comes to meet him,
Dressed as a harlot and cunning of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is boisterous and rebellious,
Her feet do not remain at home;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is now in the streets, now in the squares,
And lurks by every corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So she seizes him and kisses him
And with a brazen face she says to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I was due to offer peace offerings;
Today I have paid my vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore I have come out to meet you,
To seek your presence earnestly, and I have found you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have spread my couch with coverings,
With colored linens of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have sprinkled my bed
With myrrh, aloes and cinnamon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come, let us drink our fill of love until morning;
Let us delight ourselves with caresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For my husband is not at home,
He has gone on a long journey;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has taken a bag of money with him,
At the full moon he will come home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With her many persuasions she entices him;
With her flattering lips she seduces him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Suddenly he follows her
As an ox goes to the slaughter,
Or as one in fetters to the discipline of a fool,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now therefore, my sons, listen to me,
And pay attention to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways,
Do not stray into her paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For many are the victims she has cast down,
And numerous are all her slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her house is the way to Sheol,
Descending to the chambers of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does not wisdom call,
And understanding lift up her voice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On top of the heights beside the way,
Where the paths meet, she takes her stand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beside the gates, at the opening to the city,
At the entrance of the doors, she cries out:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To you, O men, I call,
And my voice is to the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O naive ones, understand prudence;
And, O fools, understand wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen, for I will speak noble things;
And the opening of my lips will reveal right things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For my mouth will utter truth;
And wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“All the utterances of my mouth are in righteousness;
There is nothing crooked or perverted in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They are all straightforward to him who understands,
And right to those who find knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Take my instruction and not silver,
And knowledge rather than choicest gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For wisdom is better than jewels;
And all desirable things cannot compare with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, wisdom, dwell with prudence,
And I find knowledge and discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Counsel is mine and sound wisdom;
I am understanding, power is mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“By me kings reign,
And rulers decree justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“By me princes rule, and nobles,
All who judge rightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I love those who love me;
And those who diligently seek me will find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Riches and honor are with me,
Enduring wealth and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My fruit is better than gold, even pure gold,
And my yield better than choicest silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I walk in the way of righteousness,
In the midst of the paths of justice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To endow those who love me with wealth,
That I may fill their treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord possessed me at the beginning of His way,
Before His works of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“From everlasting I was established,
From the beginning, from the earliest times of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When there were no depths I was brought forth,
When there were no springs abounding with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Before the mountains were settled,
Before the hills I was brought forth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While He had not yet made the earth and the fields,
Nor the first dust of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When He established the heavens, I was there,
When He inscribed a circle on the face of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He made firm the skies above,
When the springs of the deep became fixed,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoicing in the world, His earth,
And having my delight in the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now therefore, O sons, listen to me,
For blessed are they who keep my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Heed instruction and be wise,
And do not neglect it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed is the man who listens to me,
Watching daily at my gates,
Waiting at my doorposts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For he who finds me finds life
And obtains favor from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But he who sins against me injures himself;
All those who hate me love death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom has built her house,
She has hewn out her seven pillars;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has prepared her food, she has mixed her wine;
She has also set her table;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has sent out her maidens, she calls
From the tops of the heights of the city:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is naive, let him turn in here!”
To him who lacks understanding she says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come, eat of my food
And drink of the wine I have mixed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Forsake your folly and live,
And proceed in the way of understanding.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who corrects a scoffer gets dishonor for himself,
And he who reproves a wicked man gets insults for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not reprove a scoffer, or he will hate you,
Reprove a wise man and he will love you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give instruction to a wise man and he will be still wiser,
Teach a righteous man and he will increase his learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,
And the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by me your days will be multiplied,
And years of life will be added to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are wise, you are wise for yourself,
And if you scoff, you alone will bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The woman of folly is boisterous,
She is naive and knows nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She sits at the doorway of her house,
On a seat by the high places of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Calling to those who pass by,
Who are making their paths straight:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is naive, let him turn in here,”
And to him who lacks understanding she says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Stolen water is sweet;
And bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he does not know that the dead are there,
That her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proverbs of Solomon.
A wise son makes a father glad,
But a foolish son is a grief to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ill-gotten gains do not profit,
But righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will not allow the righteous to hunger,
But He will reject the craving of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Poor is he who works with a negligent hand,
But the hand of the diligent makes rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who gathers in summer is a son who acts wisely,
But he who sleeps in harvest is a son who acts shamefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessings are on the head of the righteous,
But the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The memory of the righteous is blessed,
But the name of the wicked will rot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise of heart will receive commands,
But a babbling fool will be ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks in integrity walks securely,
But he who perverts his ways will be found out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who winks the eye causes trouble,
And a babbling fool will be ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,
But the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hatred stirs up strife,
But love covers all transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the lips of the discerning, wisdom is found,
But a rod is for the back of him who lacks understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wise men store up knowledge,
But with the mouth of the foolish, ruin is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich man’s wealth is his fortress,
The ruin of the poor is their poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wages of the righteous is life,
The income of the wicked, punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is on the path of life who heeds instruction,
But he who ignores reproof goes astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who conceals hatred has lying lips,
And he who spreads slander is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When there are many words, transgression is unavoidable,
But he who restrains his lips is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the righteous is as choice silver,
The heart of the wicked is worth little.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous feed many,
But fools die for lack of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is the blessing of the Lord that makes rich,
And He adds no sorrow to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Doing wickedness is like sport to a fool,
And so is wisdom to a man of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What the wicked fears will come upon him,
But the desire of the righteous will be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the whirlwind passes, the wicked is no more,
But the righteous has an everlasting foundation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,
So is the lazy one to those who send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord prolongs life,
But the years of the wicked will be shortened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hope of the righteous is gladness,
But the expectation of the wicked perishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the Lord is a stronghold to the upright,
But ruin to the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will never be shaken,
But the wicked will not dwell in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of the righteous flows with wisdom,
But the perverted tongue will be cut out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous bring forth what is acceptable,
But the mouth of the wicked what is perverted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false balance is an abomination to the Lord,
But a just weight is His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When pride comes, then comes dishonor,
But with the humble is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The integrity of the upright will guide them,
But the crookedness of the treacherous will destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches do not profit in the day of wrath,
But righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the blameless will smooth his way,
But the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the upright will deliver them,
But the treacherous will be caught by their own greed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a wicked man dies, his expectation will perish,
And the hope of strong men perishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous is delivered from trouble,
But the wicked takes his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With his mouth the godless man destroys his neighbor,
But through knowledge the righteous will be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices,
And when the wicked perish, there is joyful shouting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the blessing of the upright a city is exalted,
But by the mouth of the wicked it is torn down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who despises his neighbor lacks sense,
But a man of understanding keeps silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets,
But he who is trustworthy conceals a matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there is no guidance the people fall,
But in abundance of counselors there is victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is guarantor for a stranger will surely suffer for it,
But he who hates being a guarantor is secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gracious woman attains honor,
And ruthless men attain riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The merciful man does himself good,
But the cruel man does himself harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked earns deceptive wages,
But he who sows righteousness gets a true reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is steadfast in righteousness will attain to life,
And he who pursues evil will bring about his own death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The perverse in heart are an abomination to the Lord,
But the blameless in their walk are His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Assuredly, the evil man will not go unpunished,
But the descendants of the righteous will be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a ring of gold in a swine’s snout
So is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the righteous is only good,
But the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is one who scatters, and yet increases all the more,
And there is one who withholds what is justly due, and yet it results only in want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The generous man will be prosperous,
And he who waters will himself be watered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who withholds grain, the people will curse him,
But blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who diligently seeks good seeks favor,
But he who seeks evil, evil will come to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who trusts in his riches will fall,
But the righteous will flourish like the green leaf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who troubles his own house will inherit wind,
And the foolish will be servant to the wisehearted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,
And he who is wise wins souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the righteous will be rewarded in the earth,
How much more the wicked and the sinner!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge,
But he who hates reproof is stupid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good man will obtain favor from the Lord,
But He will condemn a man who devises evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will not be established by wickedness,
But the root of the righteous will not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An excellent wife is the crown of her husband,
But she who shames him is like rottenness in his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thoughts of the righteous are just,
But the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood,
But the mouth of the upright will deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are overthrown and are no more,
But the house of the righteous will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will be praised according to his insight,
But one of perverse mind will be despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is he who is lightly esteemed and has a servant
Than he who honors himself and lacks bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous man has regard for the life of his animal,
But even the compassion of the wicked is cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who tills his land will have plenty of bread,
But he who pursues worthless things lacks sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked man desires the booty of evil men,
But the root of the righteous yields fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evil man is ensnared by the transgression of his lips,
But the righteous will escape from trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will be satisfied with good by the fruit of his words,
And the deeds of a man’s hands will return to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,
But a wise man is he who listens to counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s anger is known at once,
But a prudent man conceals dishonor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who speaks truth tells what is right,
But a false witness, deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is one who speaks rashly like the thrusts of a sword,
But the tongue of the wise brings healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truthful lips will be established forever,
But a lying tongue is only for a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deceit is in the heart of those who devise evil,
But counselors of peace have joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No harm befalls the righteous,
But the wicked are filled with trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord,
But those who deal faithfully are His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prudent man conceals knowledge,
But the heart of fools proclaims folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hand of the diligent will rule,
But the slack hand will be put to forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Anxiety in a man’s heart weighs it down,
But a good word makes it glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous is a guide to his neighbor,
But the way of the wicked leads them astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lazy man does not roast his prey,
But the precious possession of a man is diligence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the way of righteousness is life,
And in its pathway there is no death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son accepts his father’s discipline,
But a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of a man’s mouth he enjoys good,
But the desire of the treacherous is violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who guards his mouth preserves his life;
The one who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soul of the sluggard craves and gets nothing,
But the soul of the diligent is made fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous man hates falsehood,
But a wicked man acts disgustingly and shamefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness guards the one whose way is blameless,
But wickedness subverts the sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is one who pretends to be rich, but has nothing;
Another pretends to be poor, but has great wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ransom of a man’s life is his wealth,
But the poor hears no rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the righteous rejoices,
But the lamp of the wicked goes out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through insolence comes nothing but strife,
But wisdom is with those who receive counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth obtained by fraud dwindles,
But the one who gathers by labor increases it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hope deferred makes the heart sick,
But desire fulfilled is a tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who despises the word will be in debt to it,
But the one who fears the commandment will be rewarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life,
To turn aside from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good understanding produces favor,
But the way of the treacherous is hard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every prudent man acts with knowledge,
But a fool displays folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked messenger falls into adversity,
But a faithful envoy brings healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Poverty and shame will come to him who neglects discipline,
But he who regards reproof will be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Desire realized is sweet to the soul,
But it is an abomination to fools to turn away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks with wise men will be wise,
But the companion of fools will suffer harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Adversity pursues sinners,
But the righteous will be rewarded with prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children,
And the wealth of the sinner is stored up for the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abundant food is in the fallow ground of the poor,
But it is swept away by injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who withholds his rod hates his son,
But he who loves him disciplines him diligently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous has enough to satisfy his appetite,
But the stomach of the wicked is in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise woman builds her house,
But the foolish tears it down with her own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks in his uprightness fears the Lord,
But he who is devious in his ways despises Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the mouth of the foolish is a rod for his back,
But the lips of the wise will protect them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where no oxen are, the manger is clean,
But much revenue comes by the strength of the ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A trustworthy witness will not lie,
But a false witness utters lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scoffer seeks wisdom and finds none,
But knowledge is easy to one who has understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave the presence of a fool,
Or you will not discern words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wisdom of the sensible is to understand his way,
But the foolishness of fools is deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools mock at sin,
But among the upright there is good will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart knows its own bitterness,
And a stranger does not share its joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The house of the wicked will be destroyed,
But the tent of the upright will flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way which seems right to a man,
But its end is the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even in laughter the heart may be in pain,
And the end of joy may be grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The backslider in heart will have his fill of his own ways,
But a good man will be satisfied with his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The naive believes everything,
But the sensible man considers his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man is cautious and turns away from evil,
But a fool is arrogant and careless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A quick-tempered man acts foolishly,
And a man of evil devices is hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The naive inherit foolishness,
But the sensible are crowned with knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The evil will bow down before the good,
And the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor is hated even by his neighbor,
But those who love the rich are many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who despises his neighbor sins,
But happy is he who is gracious to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will they not go astray who devise evil?
But kindness and truth will be to those who devise good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all labor there is profit,
But mere talk leads only to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crown of the wise is their riches,
But the folly of fools is foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A truthful witness saves lives,
But he who utters lies is treacherous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the fear of the Lord there is strong confidence,
And his children will have refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life,
That one may avoid the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a multitude of people is a king’s glory,
But in the dearth of people is a prince’s ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is slow to anger has great understanding,
But he who is quick-tempered exalts folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A tranquil heart is life to the body,
But passion is rottenness to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who oppresses the poor taunts his Maker,
But he who is gracious to the needy honors Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked is thrust down by his wrongdoing,
But the righteous has a refuge when he dies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom rests in the heart of one who has understanding,
But in the hearts of fools it is made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness exalts a nation,
But sin is a disgrace to any people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s favor is toward a servant who acts wisely,
But his anger is toward him who acts shamefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gentle answer turns away wrath,
But a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the wise makes knowledge acceptable,
But the mouth of fools spouts folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord are in every place,
Watching the evil and the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A soothing tongue is a tree of life,
But perversion in it crushes the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool rejects his father’s discipline,
But he who regards reproof is sensible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great wealth is in the house of the righteous,
But trouble is in the income of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the wise spread knowledge,
But the hearts of fools are not so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
But the prayer of the upright is His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
But He loves one who pursues righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grievous punishment is for him who forsakes the way;
He who hates reproof will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sheol and Abaddon lie open before the Lord,
How much more the hearts of men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scoffer does not love one who reproves him,
He will not go to the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A joyful heart makes a cheerful face,
But when the heart is sad, the spirit is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mind of the intelligent seeks knowledge,
But the mouth of fools feeds on folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the days of the afflicted are bad,
But a cheerful heart has a continual feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a little with the fear of the Lord
Than great treasure and turmoil with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a dish of vegetables where love is
Than a fattened ox served with hatred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A hot-tempered man stirs up strife,
But the slow to anger calms a dispute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the lazy is as a hedge of thorns,
But the path of the upright is a highway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son makes a father glad,
But a foolish man despises his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Folly is joy to him who lacks sense,
But a man of understanding walks straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without consultation, plans are frustrated,
But with many counselors they succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man has joy in an apt answer,
And how delightful is a timely word!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The path of life leads upward for the wise
That he may keep away from Sheol below.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will tear down the house of the proud,
But He will establish the boundary of the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil plans are an abomination to the Lord,
But pleasant words are pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who profits illicitly troubles his own house,
But he who hates bribes will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the righteous ponders how to answer,
But the mouth of the wicked pours out evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is far from the wicked,
But He hears the prayer of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bright eyes gladden the heart;
Good news puts fat on the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He whose ear listens to the life-giving reproof
Will dwell among the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who neglects discipline despises himself,
But he who listens to reproof acquires understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the instruction for wisdom,
And before honor comes humility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of the heart belong to man,
But the answer of the tongue is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the ways of a man are clean in his own sight,
But the Lord weighs the motives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Commit your works to the Lord
And your plans will be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made everything for its own purpose,
Even the wicked for the day of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord;
Assuredly, he will not be unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By lovingkindness and truth iniquity is atoned for,
And by the fear of the Lord one keeps away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a man’s ways are pleasing to the Lord,
He makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a little with righteousness
Than great income with injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mind of man plans his way,
But the Lord directs his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A divine decision is in the lips of the king;
His mouth should not err in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A just balance and scales belong to the Lord;
All the weights of the bag are His concern.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is an abomination for kings to commit wicked acts,
For a throne is established on righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteous lips are the delight of kings,
And he who speaks right is loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fury of a king is like messengers of death,
But a wise man will appease it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the light of a king’s face is life,
And his favor is like a cloud with the spring rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much better it is to get wisdom than gold!
And to get understanding is to be chosen above silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The highway of the upright is to depart from evil;
He who watches his way preserves his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pride goes before destruction,
And a haughty spirit before stumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to be humble in spirit with the lowly
Than to divide the spoil with the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who gives attention to the word will find good,
And blessed is he who trusts in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise in heart will be called understanding,
And sweetness of speech increases persuasiveness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Understanding is a fountain of life to one who has it,
But the discipline of fools is folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the wise instructs his mouth
And adds persuasiveness to his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pleasant words are a honeycomb,
Sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way which seems right to a man,
But its end is the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worker’s appetite works for him,
For his hunger urges him on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worthless man digs up evil,
While his words are like scorching fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A perverse man spreads strife,
And a slanderer separates intimate friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of violence entices his neighbor
And leads him in a way that is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who winks his eyes does so to devise perverse things;
He who compresses his lips brings evil to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gray head is a crown of glory;
It is found in the way of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is slow to anger is better than the mighty,
And he who rules his spirit, than he who captures a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lot is cast into the lap,
But its every decision is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a dry morsel and quietness with it
Than a house full of feasting with strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A servant who acts wisely will rule over a son who acts shamefully,
And will share in the inheritance among brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The refining pot is for silver and the furnace for gold,
But the Lord tests hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evildoer listens to wicked lips;
A liar pays attention to a destructive tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who mocks the poor taunts his Maker;
He who rejoices at calamity will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grandchildren are the crown of old men,
And the glory of sons is their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Excellent speech is not fitting for a fool,
Much less are lying lips to a prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A bribe is a charm in the sight of its owner;
Wherever he turns, he prospers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who conceals a transgression seeks love,
But he who repeats a matter separates intimate friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rebuke goes deeper into one who has understanding
Than a hundred blows into a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rebellious man seeks only evil,
So a cruel messenger will be sent against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let a man meet a bear robbed of her cubs,
Rather than a fool in his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who returns evil for good,
Evil will not depart from his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The beginning of strife is like letting out water,
So abandon the quarrel before it breaks out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who justifies the wicked and he who condemns the righteous,
Both of them alike are an abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is there a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom,
When he has no sense?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A friend loves at all times,
And a brother is born for adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man lacking in sense pledges
And becomes guarantor in the presence of his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves transgression loves strife;
He who raises his door seeks destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has a crooked mind finds no good,
And he who is perverted in his language falls into evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who sires a fool does so to his sorrow,
And the father of a fool has no joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A joyful heart is good medicine,
But a broken spirit dries up the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked man receives a bribe from the bosom
To pervert the ways of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is in the presence of the one who has understanding,
But the eyes of a fool are on the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is a grief to his father
And bitterness to her who bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is also not good to fine the righteous,
Nor to strike the noble for their uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who restrains his words has knowledge,
And he who has a cool spirit is a man of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a fool, when he keeps silent, is considered wise;
When he closes his lips, he is considered prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who separates himself seeks his own desire,
He quarrels against all sound wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool does not delight in understanding,
But only in revealing his own mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a wicked man comes, contempt also comes,
And with dishonor comes scorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a man’s mouth are deep waters;
The fountain of wisdom is a bubbling brook.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To show partiality to the wicked is not good,
Nor to thrust aside the righteous in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s lips bring strife,
And his mouth calls for blows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s mouth is his ruin,
And his lips are the snare of his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a whisperer are like dainty morsels,
And they go down into the innermost parts of the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also who is slack in his work
Is brother to him who destroys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The name of the Lord is a strong tower;
The righteous runs into it and is safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rich man’s wealth is his strong city,
And like a high wall in his own imagination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before destruction the heart of man is haughty,
But humility goes before honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who gives an answer before he hears,
It is folly and shame to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The spirit of a man can endure his sickness,
But as for a broken spirit who can bear it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mind of the prudent acquires knowledge,
And the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s gift makes room for him
And brings him before great men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The first to plead his case seems right,
Until another comes and examines him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cast lot puts an end to strife
And decides between the mighty ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city,
And contentions are like the bars of a citadel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With the fruit of a man’s mouth his stomach will be satisfied;
He will be satisfied with the product of his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
And those who love it will eat its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who finds a wife finds a good thing
And obtains favor from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor man utters supplications,
But the rich man answers roughly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of too many friends comes to ruin,
But there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a poor man who walks in his integrity
Than he who is perverse in speech and is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also it is not good for a person to be without knowledge,
And he who hurries his footsteps errs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The foolishness of man ruins his way,
And his heart rages against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth adds many friends,
But a poor man is separated from his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
And he who tells lies will not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many will seek the favor of a generous man,
And every man is a friend to him who gives gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He who gets wisdom loves his own soul;
He who keeps understanding will find good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
And he who tells lies will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Luxury is not fitting for a fool;
Much less for a slave to rule over princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s discretion makes him slow to anger,
And it is his glory to overlook a transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s wrath is like the roaring of a lion,
But his favor is like dew on the grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is destruction to his father,
And the contentions of a wife are a constant dripping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
House and wealth are an inheritance from fathers,
But a prudent wife is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Laziness casts into a deep sleep,
And an idle man will suffer hunger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who keeps the commandment keeps his soul,
But he who is careless of conduct will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who is gracious to a poor man lends to the Lord,
And He will repay him for his good deed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Discipline your son while there is hope,
And do not desire his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of great anger will bear the penalty,
For if you rescue him, you will only have to do it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to counsel and accept discipline,
That you may be wise the rest of your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many plans are in a man’s heart,
But the counsel of the Lord will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is desirable in a man is his kindness,
And it is better to be a poor man than a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord leads to life,
So that one may sleep satisfied, untouched by evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard buries his hand in the dish,
But will not even bring it back to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strike a scoffer and the naive may become shrewd,
But reprove one who has understanding and he will gain knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who assaults his father and drives his mother away
Is a shameful and disgraceful son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cease listening, my son, to discipline,
And you will stray from the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rascally witness makes a mockery of justice,
And the mouth of the wicked spreads iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judgments are prepared for scoffers,
And blows for the back of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wine is a mocker, strong drink a brawler,
And whoever is intoxicated by it is not wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The terror of a king is like the growling of a lion;
He who provokes him to anger forfeits his own life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keeping away from strife is an honor for a man,
But any fool will quarrel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard does not plow after the autumn,
So he begs during the harvest and has nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A plan in the heart of a man is like deep water,
But a man of understanding draws it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many a man proclaims his own loyalty,
But who can find a trustworthy man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous man who walks in his integrity—
How blessed are his sons after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king who sits on the throne of justice
Disperses all evil with his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can say, “I have cleansed my heart,
I am pure from my sin”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Differing weights and differing measures,
Both of them are abominable to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is by his deeds that a lad distinguishes himself
If his conduct is pure and right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hearing ear and the seeing eye,
The Lord has made both of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not love sleep, or you will become poor;
Open your eyes, and you will be satisfied with food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Bad, bad,” says the buyer,
But when he goes his way, then he boasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is gold, and an abundance of jewels;
But the lips of knowledge are a more precious thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take his garment when he becomes surety for a stranger;
And for foreigners, hold him in pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bread obtained by falsehood is sweet to a man,
But afterward his mouth will be filled with gravel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prepare plans by consultation,
And make war by wise guidance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who goes about as a slanderer reveals secrets,
Therefore do not associate with a gossip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who curses his father or his mother,
His lamp will go out in time of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An inheritance gained hurriedly at the beginning
Will not be blessed in the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say, “I will repay evil”;
Wait for the Lord, and He will save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Differing weights are an abomination to the Lord,
And a false scale is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man’s steps are ordained by the Lord,
How then can man understand his way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a trap for a man to say rashly, “It is holy!”
And after the vows to make inquiry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise king winnows the wicked,
And drives the threshing wheel over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The spirit of man is the lamp of the Lord,
Searching all the innermost parts of his being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Loyalty and truth preserve the king,
And he upholds his throne by righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The glory of young men is their strength,
And the honor of old men is their gray hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stripes that wound scour away evil,
And strokes reach the innermost parts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s heart is like channels of water in the hand of the Lord;
He turns it wherever He wishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every man’s way is right in his own eyes,
But the Lord weighs the hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To do righteousness and justice
Is desired by the Lord more than sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Haughty eyes and a proud heart,
The lamp of the wicked, is sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of the diligent lead surely to advantage,
But everyone who is hasty comes surely to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The acquisition of treasures by a lying tongue
Is a fleeting vapor, the pursuit of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The violence of the wicked will drag them away,
Because they refuse to act with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a guilty man is crooked,
But as for the pure, his conduct is upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to live in a corner of a roof
Than in a house shared with a contentious woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soul of the wicked desires evil;
His neighbor finds no favor in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the scoffer is punished, the naive becomes wise;
But when the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous one considers the house of the wicked,
Turning the wicked to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who shuts his ear to the cry of the poor
Will also cry himself and not be answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gift in secret subdues anger,
And a bribe in the bosom, strong wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The exercise of justice is joy for the righteous,
But is terror to the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who wanders from the way of understanding
Will rest in the assembly of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves pleasure will become a poor man;
He who loves wine and oil will not become rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked is a ransom for the righteous,
And the treacherous is in the place of the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to live in a desert land
Than with a contentious and vexing woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise,
But a foolish man swallows it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who pursues righteousness and loyalty
Finds life, righteousness and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man scales the city of the mighty
And brings down the stronghold in which they trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who guards his mouth and his tongue,
Guards his soul from troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Proud,” “Haughty,” “Scoffer,” are his names,
Who acts with insolent pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the sluggard puts him to death,
For his hands refuse to work;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long he is craving,
While the righteous gives and does not hold back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination,
How much more when he brings it with evil intent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will perish,
But the man who listens to the truth will speak forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked man displays a bold face,
But as for the upright, he makes his way sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no wisdom and no understanding
And no counsel against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The horse is prepared for the day of battle,
But victory belongs to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good name is to be more desired than great wealth,
Favor is better than silver and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich and the poor have a common bond,
The Lord is the maker of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prudent sees the evil and hides himself,
But the naive go on, and are punished for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The reward of humility and the fear of the Lord
Are riches, honor and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse;
He who guards himself will be far from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Train up a child in the way he should go,
Even when he is old he will not depart from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich rules over the poor,
And the borrower becomes the lender’s slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who sows iniquity will reap vanity,
And the rod of his fury will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is generous will be blessed,
For he gives some of his food to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drive out the scoffer, and contention will go out,
Even strife and dishonor will cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves purity of heart
And whose speech is gracious, the king is his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge,
But He overthrows the words of the treacherous man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard says, “There is a lion outside;
I will be killed in the streets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit;
He who is cursed of the Lord will fall into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child;
The rod of discipline will remove it far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who oppresses the poor to make more for himself
Or who gives to the rich, will only come to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline your ear and hear the words of the wise,
And apply your mind to my knowledge;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it will be pleasant if you keep them within you,
That they may be ready on your lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that your trust may be in the Lord,
I have taught you today, even you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I not written to you excellent things
Of counsels and knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To make you know the certainty of the words of truth
That you may correctly answer him who sent you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rob the poor because he is poor,
Or crush the afflicted at the gate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will plead their case
And take the life of those who rob them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not associate with a man given to anger;
Or go with a hot-tempered man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or you will learn his ways
And find a snare for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be among those who give pledges,
Among those who become guarantors for debts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have nothing with which to pay,
Why should he take your bed from under you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not move the ancient boundary
Which your fathers have set.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When you sit down to dine with a ruler,
Consider carefully what is before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And put a knife to your throat
If you are a man of great appetite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not desire his delicacies,
For it is deceptive food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not weary yourself to gain wealth,
Cease from your consideration of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you set your eyes on it, it is gone.
For wealth certainly makes itself wings
Like an eagle that flies toward the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not eat the bread of a selfish man,
Or desire his delicacies;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For as he thinks within himself, so he is.
He says to you, “Eat and drink!”
But his heart is not with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will vomit up the morsel you have eaten,
And waste your compliments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not speak in the hearing of a fool,
For he will despise the wisdom of your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not move the ancient boundary
Or go into the fields of the fatherless,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their Redeemer is strong;
He will plead their case against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Apply your heart to discipline
And your ears to words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hold back discipline from the child,
Although you strike him with the rod, he will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall strike him with the rod
And rescue his soul from Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if your heart is wise,
My own heart also will be glad;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And my inmost being will rejoice
When your lips speak what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let your heart envy sinners,
But live in the fear of the Lord always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely there is a future,
And your hope will not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, my son, and be wise,
And direct your heart in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be with heavy drinkers of wine,
Or with gluttonous eaters of meat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the heavy drinker and the glutton will come to poverty,
And drowsiness will clothe one with rags.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to your father who begot you,
And do not despise your mother when she is old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Buy truth, and do not sell it,
Get wisdom and instruction and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice,
And he who sires a wise son will be glad in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your father and your mother be glad,
And let her rejoice who gave birth to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
